cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 mi ESE of Charleston, South Carolina and 325 mi S of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest, forecast to reach the North Carolina coast tonight then cross eastern North Carolina, southeastern Virginia, and the Delmarva Peninsula through Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: North Carolina coast (likely between Cape Lookout and Cape Fear)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No tropical storm watch in effect; storm-surge watch Surf City NC to Duck NC, Chesapeake Bay north of Windmill Point to Smith Point, Tidal Potomac south of Colonial Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE, including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach; Storm-Surge Warning Duck NC to Chincoteague VA, Chesapeake Bay south of Windmill Point
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North Carolina through Virginia and the Delmarva Peninsula, including Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (sustained 30–40 kt, gusts higher) beginning early Saturday and lasting into Saturday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible along the lower Chesapeake Bay, including the Port of Virginia terminals
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with localized amounts near 7 inches could produce urban and small-stream flooding in the Hampton Roads area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; a few tornadoes possible Saturday
